name: Sidecar Cocktail
author: Home Happy Hour
summary: The Ritz Hotel in Paris claims to have created this cocktail in the early 20th century. The potent combination of Cognac and orange-flavored liqueur shaken until ice cold with lemon juice is a timeless classic.
ingredients: 1 fluid ounce orange-flavored liqueur (such as Cointreau®)
directions: Sprinkle sugar on a small plate
Lightly wet half the rim of of a coupe glass with a damp paper towel
Dip the moistened rim in sugar to coat
Set the glass in the refrigerator to chill
Combine Cognac, orange-flavored liqueur, and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker
Add ice, cover, and shake until  chilled
Strain into the chilled, sugar-rimmed coupe
